issue.title: Unknown error when setting params with argocd app set on helm app

milestone.title: v1.3
milestone.description:
Helm first-class support and Namespace View.

RC-1 targeted 8th Oct.
GA targeted 29th Oct.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
We have the following example values.yaml file for helm application:
```
dashboards:
 clustersmonitoringjson:
   {

         "select": [
            [
              {
                "params": [
                  "status"
                ],
                "type": "field"
              }
            ]
         ]
    }
```
In our case we do not want to place these properties to default values yaml file so we want to pass them through argo app set command. In this case the values are represented like that:
```
dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].params[0]=status
```
and

```
dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].type=field
```
Which is described in the official helm documentation regarding set command: https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/master/docs/using_helm.md

When we apply the commands to any type of helm application, despite that it uses the values or it is part of your example apps repo (https://github.com/argoproj/argocd-example-apps.git), the same error appears:

**To Reproduce**
Execute the following commands:
1. Create app:

```
argocd app create helmguestbook \
  --repo https://github.com/argoproj/argocd-example-apps.git \
  --path helm-guestbook \
  --dest-server https://kubernetes.default.svc \
  --dest-namespace default
```
2. Set the two parameters(Please keep in mind that you have to set both of them):
```
argocd app set helmguestbook -p  dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].params[0]=status -p dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].type=field

```
3. Check the error in UI
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20355672/62051140-66cbbc80-b21b-11e9-8f81-51e86f9052b8.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20355672/62051189-8531b800-b21b-11e9-8acb-2cd62042760c.png)


4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The application should not be broken. The issues comes from the fact that `helm --set` should not be used multiple times. According to the official helm documentation, multiple values should be separated by commas. For example:
```
--set dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].type=field, dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].params[0]=status
```
Currently, argo is executing the helm template command as follow:
```
helm template . --namespace default --set dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].params[0]=status --set dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].type=field --name helmguestbook
```

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

body:
I am able to reproduce this issue using these steps:

```
$ helm create issue-6116

$ helm template issue-6116 --namespace default --set "dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].params[0]=status" --set "dashboards.clustersmonitoringjson.select[0][0].type=field" --name helmguestbook
```

helm client version 
```
$ Client: &version.Version{SemVer:"v2.14.2", GitCommit:"a8b13cc5ab6a7dbef0a58f5061bcc7c0c61598e7", GitTreeState:"clean"}
```

I am working on a PR to fix this issue

issue.title: fix stack overflow error in helm template.

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
fix #6116

When value has a nested list in "helm template --set" cmd and the nested list already has a value, it may becomes endless nested list. And it will result in stack overflow.

My solution is to judge the nested list if it already has a value, and if it is yes, take the value of list to next cycle.
